data.title: More types for CompletionItemKind enum
data.body:
And then add an appropriate icon to display in completion lists.  The PowerShellEditorServices extension helps the user auto-complete paths.  When you have a list of folder contents it is very helpful to have an icon to distinguish between files and folders.

Compare this UI from VSCode for path completion:
![vscodeintellisenseforfolders](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5177512/12738637/c2f55676-c91f-11e5-9b00-a076ccc90701.png)

To the UI from PowerShell ISE:
![iseintellisenseforfolders](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5177512/12738642/ce19387e-c91f-11e5-9b43-6e60ce773399.png)
Having a nice, flat icon for a folder would be very nice to show in this list.

data.title: Add message that indicates you can press ESC to cancel a search, fixes #2494
data.body: Fixes #2494

data.title: [0.10.7-insider] Debug Console only displays a single line of output
data.body:
Not sure if I caused this somehow, but in the new Insider release I only see a single line of update when debugging PowerShell scripts:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79405/12735762/3d22b248-c8ff-11e5-9867-4d9f5c16799b.png)

This line gets updated as new output gets written but it's never able to scroll.  Known issue?

data.title: Open in new editor problem
data.body:
Here's the repro of the problem:
1. Open up a workspace/folder in VS Code that contains 3+ files
2. Open up _file1_ in a new editor
3. Hold `CTRL` while opening _file2_, which opens it in a new editor
   
   > **Current state: two editors open, and the cursor is on the _left_ editor**
4. Hold down `CTRL` while opening _file3_

What this does, instead of creating a _third_ editor and having _file3_ open in this new editor (with _file1_ and _file2_ already opened in their respective editor), it opens _file3_ in the _second_ editor where _file2_ was previously living, and therefore replacing _file2_ in this _second_ editor.

I believe a better behavior would be for _file3_ to open up in a new editor, no matter which editor the current cursor/focus is on.  The end state here should have been all three editors open with each file in the open editors.

data.title: Support wildcards for files when running from command line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When starting vsode from the command line with a single filepath argument, vscode correctly opens the file.
However, if the filepath includes wildcards, vscode thinks that one is trying to create a new file with wildcards in its name, whereas my expectation is that it opens all files that match the filepath.
For example, I would have expected "code _.js" to run vscode and automatically open all "_.js" files in the current directory.

data.title: Poor screen reader support while debugging
data.body:
While using the NVDA screen reader, no speech is outputted while debugging and moving around in the code editor window in most instances.  Seemingly randomly, speech will work for  part of the time but then stop again. 
Issue was observed using VS 2013, untested in VS 2015 so far.

data.title: Unable to debug while attached to process and ZoomText screen magnifier running
data.body:
If you attempt to hit a breakpoint while attached to a process and running the ZoomText screen magnifier software, it will cause visual studio to hang and then crash.
This is observed in VS 2013, untested in VS 2015 so far.

data.title: Test new Marketplace API
data.body:
Marketplace team wants us to test out some API changes they made. These are their instructions. 

We made some modifications to the existing API in the last sprint, that enhanced the capabilities of the current API. I’ve highlighted some of them below
- Introduced search text filter type that gives results matching, extension name, publisher name and short description. It currently matches prefix based (for instance it’ll provide eslint as a result if you search for just es)
- Fuzzy search for verb variations of keyword i.e. matching coding when searching for code etc
- Support for exact phrase match in case of multiple word queries
- Search across multiple categories

Documentation for the API is [here](http://aka.ms/extensionqueryAPIdoc).

data.title: VSC slows down significantly after ~1 day of use, requires restart
data.body:
I'm on OS X El Capitan 10.11.3

I work on relatively small JS files most days. After around a day of use, VSC gets to the point where text editing is nearly impossible due to the delay in keyboard input. A restart fixes this issue.

data.title: Add more entries from the About menu to command pallette

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: The entire help menu is missing in the command palette. So, I can surmise that it was a design decision to not potentially "pollute" the command palette. But there are useful items, like "Check for updates", "About" to quickly view version info, and "Toggle dev tools". Perhaps, add these options to the command palette?

data.title: VSC crashes when left open for extended periods
data.body:
I usually leave VSC running when I leave work for the day. But every following morning I come in and wake up my machine, I find a message informing me that VSC has crashed.

I should note that the machine VSC is running on is a virtual machine. I haven't observed issues with other machines.

data.title: VSCode accesses desktop.ini on start
data.body:
Environment:
Windows 10 Version 1511 Build 10586, Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14251
VSCode 0.10.6

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3396686/12724065/8683285a-c94f-11e5-9866-823f3001046b.png)

This randomly occurs when starting VSCode and it turns on my secondary hard drive with no real use.

Please ask me if you need more information.

data.title: February Iteration Plan
data.body:
February is our last full iteration before we start the end game for the [Build 2016](http://build.microsoft.com/) milestone at the end of March.

We made good progress in the areas such as accessibility and localization, but more work needs to happen. Therefore we arrived at the following themes for February:
- Continue the work on accessibility, localization.
- Reduce adoption blockers - the item we want to tackle is support for _Code Folding_, the most voted for [feature request](https://visualstudio.uservoice.com/forums/293070-visual-studio-code/suggestions/7752321-add-code-folding-support), Issue #105.
- Reduce the engineering debt.
- Respond to feedback and try to address as many issues as possible.

For more information about our development process please refer to the development process [page](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process).
### [Endgame](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process#end-game) Schedule
##### Monday, Feb 22
- [x] Code freeze at end of day
##### Tuesday
- [x] Test build done
- [x] Testing
##### Wednesday
- [x] Testing
- [x] Fixing
- [x] Omnisharp Smoke Test @weinand 
- [x] Run OSS tool @isidorn 
##### Thursday
- [x] Fixing
- [x] Verification
##### Friday
- [x] Fixing
- [x] Smoketest
  - [x] Windows @alexandrudima 
  - [x] OS X @isidorn
  - [x] Linux @aeschli
- [x] All release notes updated @weinand 
- [ ] All issues verified
- ~~Signing process initiated @joaomoreno~~ Not needed, we can now sign ourselves.
- [ ] Satellite modules ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [ ] vscode @bpasero 
  - [ ] yo generator @aeschli 
  - [x] vsce @joaomoreno: published vsce@1.2.0
  - [x] Debug adapter @weinand 
  - [x] Language client/server @dbaeumer 
  - [x] eslint (recommended linter for JS) @dbaeumer 
##### Monday, Feb 29
- [x] Release [`insider`](https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/vscode/2016/02/01/introducing-insiders-builds/) channel
##### Monday, March 7
- [ ] Release `stable` channel
### Plan Items

| Mark | Description |
| --- | --- |
| :runner: | work in progress |
| :hand: | task is blocked |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration |
#### Feedback

Issues to address feedback from the community:
- [x] Support folding in the editor #105 @aeschli 
  - Test: #2994 
  - [x]  Release Notes
- [x] Editor - Supporting ruler settings #1673 @alexandrudima 
  - Test: #3233
  - [x]  Release Notes
- [x] Editor - Improve tab and space insertion handling, show what tab size is guessed, support to convert tabs to space and vice versa #1228 @isidorn 
  - Test: #3234
  - [x] Release Notes
- [x] Editor - Add EOL option #2957 @alexandrudima 
  - [x] Release Notes
- [x] UI - Provide action to "Open definition to the side" #2660 (see also #2646) @bpasero
  - Test: #3236
  - [x]  Release Notes
- [x] UI - "Close all but this" context menu option for working files #2643 @bpasero
  - Test: #3235 
  - [x]  Release Notes
- [x] UI - Support to switch to a working file from the quick box #441 @bpasero
  - Test: #2791

- [x] UI - Experimental support for recommending extensions based on usage/setup @jrieken 
  - Test: #2734

- [x] UI - Improve the suggest widget performance #1923 @joaomoreno 
  - Test: #3237
  - [x]  Release Notes
- [x] Debug - Failed preLaunchTask's should abort debugger launch #2370 @isidorn 
  - Test: #2940 
  - [x]  Release Notes
- [x] Debug - Support asp.net debug scenario (was #2263)
  - ~~Add snippet support to tasks.json #3122 @dbaeumer~~

data.title: Seed the native file dialog with the parent of the currently active file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Whenever I use "Open File", the box defaults from some default directory.  I would like the Open File dialog to show the directory that the current file is in.  99% of the time when I open a file it is to find some sibling file to the one I'm looking at.  

Either a user setting, or a completely new command would be great.

data.title: InputBox: decorations are not indicated to screen readers
data.body: Should try to use the appropriate roles so that the input box decorations are reaching the screen reader properly.

data.title: False positive: program path uses differently cased character than file on disk
data.body:
1. generate a `launch.json`, e.g with a program `${workspaceRoot}/fib.js`
2. change the program to have a double // instead of / e.g. `${workspaceRoot}//fib.js`
3. notice the error from the adapter 'program path uses differently cased character than file on disk...', which is not correct. I would expect the second / is ignored

data.title: VSCode does not respect window layout during debugging [Windows]
data.body: Browser snapped to left hand side, VSCode snapped to right hand side with breakpoints set. start debugging. Click something on webpage to hit a breakpoint, VSCode undocks from right-hand side and have to re-snap it to get back to original window layout.

data.title: Node.js debug: Generated launch.json produces wrong program entry
data.body:
- standup sample (get from https://github.com/bpasero/standup)
- press F5 and pick NodeJS to generate

=> you end up with a launch.json that has:

```
"program": "${workspaceRoot}index.js"
```

And you see the error that index.js cannot be found.

Works fine with:

```
"program": "${workspaceRoot}/index.js"
```

data.title: add emmet support for .erb and .php files

VSCode fails to format large (in this case approx. 27 MB) XML files. It won't event give any feedback. This is a one-line XML file.

_Cheers,_

System is an up to date Ubuntu 15.10

Thanks,
Philipp

data.title: Find: Counter does not update when I Cmd+Enter a replace all operation
data.body: Instead, the counter stays.

data.title: QuickFix generate method should not add using directive
data.body:
`editor.action.quickFix` currently adds a `using System` directive to the containing file when generating methods.

This is not always convenient and often means that the using has to be removed once the method has been fully implemented.

A lighter approach would be to change the generated method's body to `throw new System.NotImplementedException();` instead.

data.title: Suggest is still slow (saw in selfhost)
Windows: projectResolver.test.ts failing
data.body:
Seems to happen ever since  https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/d3062aa162aae5d428ccee193f19d61c8871a46d

FileService.resolveContent() is called with `\tsconfig.json` and returns null as a matter of that.

data.title: Repl: reveal last line when I expand an object

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: When I expand an object at the end of the repl, I always find myself scrolling down. I suggest to just reveal the object when you click the expand icon. Maybe be smart and only reveal up to the node that gets expanded to prevent bad scrolling for a very large object.
